SENT.plain: We serially determined serum erythropoietin (Epo) and the reticulocyte count in patients with various types of leukemia during chemotherapy
Serum Epo increased soon after the initiation of chemotherapy and decreased after the termination of therapy irrespective of the types of leukemia or treatment regimen
However, it did not stay at low level but fluctuated
The reticulocyte count, on the other hand, showed a transient rise while serum Epo level descended
The value of serum Epo when increased was higher than the value expected from hemoglobin concentration; this finding was similar to that in aplastic anemia
These results suggest that myelosuppression is a major factor for the increase in serum Epo level during leukemia chemotherapy
